decks.notes: The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly build a board presence with efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, supported by burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment. The deck also aims to disrupt opponent's mana base with cards like Blood Moon and Static Prison, while continuing to apply pressure with cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. Overall, the deck is focused on aggressive plays and overwhelming the opponent before they can stabilize.

The deck focuses on utilizing Jeskai Ascendancy as the core combo piece to generate mana and draw cards while pumping up creatures. Mox Opal, Mishra's Bauble, and Emry, Lurker of the Loch help to ramp up mana quickly, while cards like Repeal and Metallic Rebuke provide disruption and control. Urza's Saga provides additional value by tutoring for artifacts, creating a strong synergy with cards like Portable Hole and Mox Amber. Overall, the goal is to establish a dominant board state and overwhelm the opponent with a powerful combo finish.

This deck revolves around utilizing creatures and enchantments to disrupt the opponent's game plan while pressuring them with aggressive plays. By locking down their board with cards like Sanctifier en-Vec and Quantum Riddler, as well as bouncing threats with Teferi, Time Raveler, the deck aims to control the board and sneak in damage with evasive creatures like Geist of Saint Traft. With a mix of disruption and efficient beaters, this Death and Taxes deck seeks to disrupt opponents' strategies while quickly closing out games.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quick and aggressive gameplay, aiming to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and powerful spells. The deck utilizes cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls to put pressure on the opponent early on, while also having access to burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to finish off opponents or clear blockers. The inclusion of cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Seasoned Pyromancer provide additional value and card advantage, making this deck a formidable force in the Modern 1 vs 1 format.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures like Voice of Victory and Ocelot Pride, backed up by burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to control the board and finish off opponents. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ephemerate to provide additional threats and card advantage. Arena of Glory helps pump up your creatures, while Seasoned Pyromancer and Witch Enchanter provide card draw and value. With a mix of creatures, burn spells, and powerful planeswalkers, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with speed and efficiency.

The deck revolves around assembling a powerful combo using cards that do not require lands to function. By utilizing cards like Goblin Charbelcher and Lotus Bloom, the deck aims to manipulate the opponent's board state and disrupt their plans while setting up its own win condition. With a mix of counterspells, card draw, and alternative win conditions, the deck creates a versatile and unpredictable playstyle that can catch opponents off guard and secure victories through unexpected avenues.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying a board full of cheap artifacts to power up various synergies. The key strategy is to flood the board with artifacts such as Ornithopter and Memnite, then use cards like Springleaf Drum and Mox Opal to generate mana efficiently. Thoughtcast and Mishra's Bauble provide card advantage, while Urza's Saga can search for key artifacts to further strengthen the board. Emry, Lurker of the Loch can recur artifacts from the graveyard, adding resilience to the deck's aggressive game plan.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly through rituals and medallions to cast a large number of spells in a single turn. It aims to utilize cards like Past in Flames and Ral, Monsoon Mage to replay spells from the graveyard and deal massive damage with spells like Grapeshot. The deck also includes cards like Wish and Glimpse the Impossible for additional versatility and card advantage. The key strategy is to chain together spells to create a storm of damage in a short amount of time, overwhelming opponents with a burst of powerful spells.

This deck focuses on using Allosaurus Rider to quickly bring out powerful creatures like Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant and Griselbrand by sacrificing creatures with Eldritch Evolution and Neoform. It also utilizes cards like Consign to Memory and Planar Genesis to control the board and generate advantage. The deck includes protection with Pact of Negation and Veil of Summer, along with ramp options like Bridgeworks Battle and Generous Gift. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces quickly and overwhelm the opponent with massive creatures.

The deck revolves around ramping up quickly and efficiently to get Primeval Titan onto the battlefield, allowing for explosive land combos and searching for key lands like Urza's Saga. The deck uses a mix of land bounce effects and mana acceleration to generate immense value from the lands in play, setting up for a game-winning Scapeshift or combo finish with lands like Gruul Turf and Lotus Field. The inclusion of cards like Cultivator Colossus and Vexing Bauble provide additional utility and support for the main combo strategy.

The deck focuses on building a board presence quickly with low-cost artifacts and creatures, utilizing cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum to ramp up mana production. Metalcraft abilities from cards like Memnite and Pinnacle Emissary are key for maximizing card value and triggering powerful effects. Urza's Saga provides additional value by tutoring for artifacts, while Engineered Explosives and Metallic Rebuke offer control options. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of early aggression and efficiency, ultimately outpacing them to secure victory.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. The deck also includes control elements such as Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with big threats while controlling the board to secure victory. The deck utilizes a mix of ramp, removal, and high-impact creatures to dominate the game and establish dominance.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler. The deck includes low-cost spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to deal damage efficiently and pump up creatures. The card selection and filtering provided by cards like Expressive Iteration and Preordain help maintain consistency and keep the pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Mutagenic Growth and Violent Urge provide additional ways to pump up creatures and push through damage, while Mishra's Bauble helps with card advantage.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on playing small, efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter, while using spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to control the board and deal direct damage to the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Mishra's Bauble to help with card selection and consistency. By quickly building a board presence and applying pressure to the opponent, this deck aims to close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to create a powerful control strategy using the UrzaTron lands to quickly ramp up mana and cast high-cost Eldrazi creatures and planeswalkers. By utilizing cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, Eye of the Storms, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining board control with cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Glaring Fleshraker. This deck focuses on using efficient removal spells and powerful threats to outvalue the opponent and secure victory in the late game.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with disruptive creatures and spells like Sanctifier en-Vec and Teferi, Time Raveler, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Quantum Riddler and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd. The deck aims to control the board and slow down the opponent's strategy through taxing effects and removal spells like Prismatic Ending. With a mix of protection spells like Solitude and card advantage engines like Ephemerate, the deck looks to out value and outmaneuver opponents in a grindy game plan.
